content:
Yoga is an excellent choice! Consistency is key, and with the right resources, you can establish a strong practice. Here are some popular yoga apps and online resources to help you get started:

**Yoga Apps:**

1. **Down Dog** (down.dog) - Offers various yoga styles, meditation, and music options. (Free trial, then subscription-based)
2. **Yoga Studio** (yogastudioapp.com) - Features over 65 classes, customizable sequences, and a pose library. (One-time purchase)
3. **YogaGlo** (yogaglo.com) - Provides a vast library of classes, meditation, and Pilates. (Free trial, then subscription-based)
4. **Pocket Yoga** (pocket-yoga.com) - A comprehensive app with poses, classes, and a pose editor. (One-time purchase)
5. **Alo Moves** (alomoves.com) - Offers yoga, Pilates, and meditation classes, with a focus on varying levels and styles. (Free trial, then subscription-based)

**Online Resources:**

1. **Yoga International** (yogainternational.com) - A vast online yoga platform with classes, articles, and tutorials.
2. **Do You Yoga** (doyouyoga.com) - Features a wide range of classes, tutorials, and challenges.
3. **Yoga With Adriene** (yogawithadriene.com) - Adriene's YouTube channel and website offer free yoga classes, tutorials, and meditations.
4. **Gaia** (gaia.com) - A yoga and wellness platform with classes, meditation, and documentaries. (Free trial, then subscription-based)
5. **YouTube Yoga Channels** - Search for popular channels like Fightmaster Yoga, Dylan Werner Yoga, and Power Yoga With Bryan.

**Tips for Establishing a Consistent Routine:**

1. **Start small**: Begin with 2-3 times a week and gradually increase frequency as you become more comfortable.
2. **Choose a schedule**: Decide on a specific time and day to practice yoga, and try to stick to it.
3. **Create a dedicated space**: Designate a quiet, comfortable area for your yoga practice to help you stay focused.
4. **Invest in a good yoga mat**: A good mat can provide grip, comfort, and support for your joints.
5. **Listen to your body**: Honor your body's limitations and take rest days as needed.

Remember, consistency is key, but it's also essential to listen to your body and not push yourself too hard. Enjoy your yoga journey!
